comment: Literally terrible. Does group projects that are mind numbingly pointless. The group project is huge and if you are stuck with a bad group, oh well there goes 20% of your grade. Do not take if you can help it. I made a rate my professor account just to give her a bad score.

Assignments include 14 McGraw Hill connect quizzes and smartbooks, midterm/final, intro discussion post, a number of SIMnet assignments in Excel and Access, and a group project. Everything was open book/notes. The assignments weren't very hard, so as long as you complete them, you will be fine.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Fluker's instructions are not clear and she doesn't clarify if you ask, she will just reread the instructions from the word doc she provides. This was a hybrid class so we only met once a week. she was always late. She didn't teach anything. If you missed class 10 points were deducted from points you already earned from previous assignments.

Most confusing professor ever! Run! She makes class harder than what it is and she gives little to no instruction on the weekly assignments. Wants us to be understanding of her situations but isn't understanding of ours. She does no teaching so you basically have to guide and teach yourself and gives unreasonable time to work on lengthy assignments

yes we all like to get out of class early but semester has just started, this is a hybrid class we meet once a week. This was our third week we only saw her 1 1/2 times. Horrible at explaining work. Rather you get a zero than to help you figure out an assignment. Careless to say the least and wants you to use school computer during COVID-19

Fluker is very kind and passionate about her job. Because I had a hybrid class, we only had to show up in person a few times. When we did, I felt that she talked too long and there wasn't a real need for us to be there. Weekly chapter quizzes, easy to do. Exams and group projects are easy as well. Overall, easy class.
This class was hard to understand online. I would have enjoyed it more in a classroom because the material is very difficult.

Professor Fluker is a pretty solid professor. There wasn't much work except for the projects that we had to do. There were weekly quizzes but they were super easy to do. We had to get the pearson thing but she didn't use it as a grade. The projects were pretty easy and straight forward. Use the rubrics for the projects so you don't miss anything.

I took this course online with Prof. Fluker. What I learned through looking at all of the IS Professors is that they all have low scores and it made me realize it isn't the professors as much as it is the content of the class. There is a ton of reading, quizzes and group projects. She was fair and responsive. I would take her again, absolutely.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Worst Professor ever. I somehow managed to scrape by with a B, but in all, this is the most difficult course I have taken in my college career. The Professor grades incredibly harsh, and takes major points off on most assignments for reasons that were not clearly asked for in the assignment's page. I felt disrespected by most of her feedback.

Professor Fluker has a few redeeming qualities. For my class, she gave us a lot work at home days and the majority of our quizzes were taken at home. She also made most of our work group work and gave us ample time to complete the work. However, she is not a good professor. Assignments are complicated, explained poorly, and harshly graded.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She's the worst professor i've ever had. So incredibly unorganized, very unclear about her directions. Just don't take her class because you learn absolutely nothing from her class and she gives TONS of work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Take another professor. She is very strict and difficult for a mandatory class. You have 1-2 difficult online quizzes in class everyday (she watches your computer screens), if you are more than 15 minutes late you get points deducted from your final grade, particular about grading, etc. Overall probably the worst professor for this course.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dont take her. She is clueless and doesnt belong in the classroom. I learned absolutely nothing, automatic deduction for absence, ridiculous amounts of projects (5 total). If you cant get a seat in any other class, just wait till another time to take. Worst professor at KSU.

If you have to take ICT please take it online. This class is a joke, she has no idea what she is talking about. She could never answer any of our questions. She doesn't make any of the assignments or tests. The only thing you do in class is make powerpoints about the book and then present them. I am currently doing my last assignment and crying.

Since I absolute hate techy computer stuff anyways, that class was very hard for me. All you do is homework  e v e r y  week. And the tests are not easy, I studied really hard and did all the homework (don't skip anything) and I did okay. Take it online if you can, the hybrid doesn't do much for you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: A lot of people misunderstand Dr. Fluker. Many people will leave bad reviews, but that's probably because they didn't show up to class often or perhaps have too low an IQ to understand how to take an open-book test. Her class is easy. Just show up.  And contrary to what people say, she DOES care you get the material and that you get a good grade.
I would not take her for any class. She is by far the worst professor. Does not explain anything, she's always late for class, does not know what she is talking about. AND YOU HAVE TO TEACH YOURSELF.

She's an actual joke. I took this as a hybrid because it was required for my major and it's the hardest class I've ever taken. There's a ton of busy work and that helps balance out your grade, but the tests are impossible to pass. Most of the questions are worth 12 points each. I would not recommend taking her; she doesn't help you at all.
She is TH EWORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD. A STRAIGHT UP DUMBASS! DOSE NOT KNOW THE MATERIAL AND IS RELUCTANT TO OFFER HELP. BE PREPARED TO TEACH YOURSELF.
Honestly, a really awful teacher. I wouldn't reccommend this teacher to anyone. She makes the class teach itself, offers absolutely no help, and you're frustrated most of the time.

I can't believe she is teaching a computer class when she doesn't know the difference between Internet Explorer and Google Chrome. She doesn't teach she makes you present part of the textbook to the class and expects you understand it immediately. She is not very good when you come to her for help either. Be prepared to teach yourself everything!

She has no idea what she is doing in the class. She follows a schedule from another professor that she did not create. She is always unprepared and is terrible at accommodating to uncontrollable circumstances. She sends a million emails about what is coming up that makes the workload ridiculous.
